School starts Monday, 8/17th!

We are excited and we hope you are too. Please make note of the updates below.

If you have not yet come to the school to pick up your student's virtual learning kit, please do so today, Friday (8/14), 8 a.m. - 4 p.m.

If you have not tried to log into your student's Google Classroom, please do so immediately and notify your student's teacher of any connectivity issues.

All other tech support issues should go to technology@bricolagenola.org

Our virtual learning model is a blend of synchronous and asynchronous instruction.

-With synchronous meaning that you/your child attends learning at the same time with the teacher.
-The difference between the two lies with the placement of the student with the teacher, not the class. Synchronous on the teacher’s schedule, asynchronous on the student’s schedule.

Under no circumstances can synchronous classes or LIVE Zoom sessions with teachers be recorded, screenshot or photographed (with a computer or a cell phone). This is a violation of FERPA.

post_text: Juneteenth is not the day that all enslaved people were freed or the day slavery ended. The Emancipation Proclamation was made effective in 1863, but it was not until June 19, 1865 that more than 250,000 enslaved black people in the state of Texas were freed by executive decree. Today our community celebrates that freedom. We also take time to recognize the social injustices that still exist today and our collective duty to educate our community on the significance of this day to Black Americans.
